Description: Moses, the ten plagues and the ten commandments; Moses, with horns on his head, stands on a pedestal; down the front of his tunic are ten tablets with the ten commandments inscribed; he holds a tablet with Christ's summary of the commandments and a scroll with "Decem Abusiones Plebis"; down the left side are the plagues of Egypt in ten compartments, each described on a scroll next to it; down the right side are the sins which violate the commandments, also described on scrolls Woodcut with hand-colouring
Curator's comments: According to Schreiber Suabian in origin. Lit.: M. Merback, 'Between these Two Kingdoms: Exile, Election, and Godly Law in Sebald Beham's Moses and Aaron' Art History 40:2 (April 2017), fig. 6.
Bibliographic references: Schreiber 1926-1930 / Handbuch der Holz- und Metalschnitte des XV Jahrhunderts (1844)
Dodgson 1903, 1911 / Catalogue of Early German and Flemish Woodcuts in the BM, 2 vols (A.118)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Theodor Oswald Weigel (sale Leipzig 27.v.1872/144)
